       ----iinnppuutt__mmeetthhooddddiirr
              Target  location  for  Input  Methods.  Default: ~~//LLiibbrraarryy//IInnppuutt
              MMeetthhooddss

       ----iinntteerrnneett__pplluuggiinnddiirr
              Target location for Internet Plugins. Default:  ~~//LLiibbrraarryy//IInntteerr--
              nneett PPlluugg--IInnss

       ----aauuddiioo__uunniitt__pplluuggiinnddiirr
              Target    location    for    Audio    Unit   Plugins.   Default:
              ~~//LLiibbrraarryy//AAuuddiioo//PPlluugg--IInnss//CCoommppoonneennttss

       ----vvsstt__pplluuggiinnddiirr
              Target     location     for      VST      Plugins.      Default:
              ~~//LLiibbrraarryy//AAuuddiioo//PPlluugg--IInnss//VVSSTT

       ----vvsstt33__pplluuggiinnddiirr
              Target      location      for     VST3     Plugins.     Default:
              ~~//LLiibbrraarryy//AAuuddiioo//PPlluugg--IInnss//VVSSTT33

       ----ssccrreeeenn__ssaavveerrddiirr
              Target location for  Screen  Savers.  Default:  ~~//LLiibbrraarryy//SSccrreeeenn
              SSaavveerrss

       ----llaanngguuaaggee
              Set language of the Cask to install. The first matching language
              is used, otherwise the default language on the Cask. The default
              value is the llaanngguuaaggee ooff yyoouurr ssyysstteemm

   cclleeaannuupp [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a|_c_a_s_k]
       Remove  stale  lock  files  and outdated downloads for all formulae and
       casks, and remove old versions of installed formulae. If arguments  are
       specified,  only  do this for the given formulae and casks. Removes all
       downloads more than 120 days old.  This  can  be  adjusted  with  HHOOMMEE--
       BBRREEWW__CCLLEEAANNUUPP__MMAAXX__AAGGEE__DDAAYYSS.

       ----pprruunnee
              Remove all cache files older than specified _d_a_y_s.

       --nn, ----ddrryy--rruunn
              Show what would be removed, but do not actually remove anything.

       --ss     Scrub the cache, including downloads for even  the  latest  ver-
              sions.  Note  downloads for any installed formulae or casks will
              still not be deleted. If you want to delete those  too:  rrmm  --rrff
              ""$$((bbrreeww ----ccaacchhee))""

       ----pprruunnee--pprreeffiixx
              Only  prune  the  symlinks  and  directories from the prefix and
              remove no other files.

   ccoommmmaannddss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Show lists of built-in and external commands.

       --qq, ----qquuiieett
              List only the names of commands without category headers.

       ----iinncclluuddee--aalliiaasseess
              Include aliases of internal commands.

   ccoonnffiigg
       Show Homebrew and system configuration info useful  for  debugging.  If
       you  file  a  bug report, you will be required to provide this informa-
       tion.

   ddeeppss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Show dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a. Additional options specific  to  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       may  be appended to the command. When given multiple formula arguments,
       show the intersection of dependencies for each formula.

       --nn     Sort dependencies in topological order.

       ----11    Only show dependencies one level down, instead of recursing.

       ----uunniioonn
              Show the union of dependencies for multiple _f_o_r_m_u_l_a, instead  of
              the intersection.

       ----ffuullll--nnaammee
              List dependencies by their full name.

       ----iinncclluuddee--bbuuiilldd
              Include ::bbuuiilldd dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----iinncclluuddee--ooppttiioonnaall
              Include ::ooppttiioonnaall dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----iinncclluuddee--tteesstt
              Include ::tteesstt dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a (non-recursive).

       ----sskkiipp--rreeccoommmmeennddeedd
              Skip ::rreeccoommmmeennddeedd dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----iinncclluuddee--rreeqquuiirreemmeennttss
              Include requirements in addition to dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----ttrreeee Show  dependencies  as a tree. When given multiple formula argu-
              ments, show individual trees for each formula.

       ----aannnnoottaattee
              Mark any build, test, optional, or recommended  dependencies  as
              such in the output.

       ----iinnssttaalllleedd
              List  dependencies for formulae that are currently installed. If
              _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is specified, list only its dependencies that  are  cur-
              rently installed.

       ----aallll  List dependencies for all available formulae.

       ----ffoorr--eeaacchh
              Switch  into  the  mode  used by the ----aallll option, but only list
              dependencies for each provided _f_o_r_m_u_l_a, one  formula  per  line.
              This is used for debugging the ----iinnssttaalllleedd/----aallll display mode.

   ddeesscc [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] (_t_e_x_t|//_t_e_x_t//|_f_o_r_m_u_l_a)
       Display  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a's  name and one-line description. Formula descriptions
       are cached; the cache is created  on  the  first  search,  making  that
       search slower than subsequent ones.

       --ss, ----sseeaarrcchh
              Search  both names and descriptions for _t_e_x_t. If _t_e_x_t is flanked
              by slashes, it is interpreted as a regular expression.

       --nn, ----nnaammee
              Search just names for _t_e_x_t. If _t_e_x_t is flanked by slashes, it is
              interpreted as a regular expression.

       --dd, ----ddeessccrriippttiioonn
              Search  just  descriptions  for  _t_e_x_t.  If  _t_e_x_t  is  flanked by
              slashes, it is interpreted as a regular expression.

   ddooccttoorr [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Check your system for potential problems. Will  exit  with  a  non-zero
       status  if  any  potential  problems  are found. Please note that these
       warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers with  debugging
       if  you  file  an  issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is working
       fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this.

       ----lliisstt--cchheecckkss
              List all audit methods, which can be run  individually  if  pro-
              vided as arguments.

       --DD, ----aauuddiitt--ddeebbuugg
              Enable debugging and profiling of audit methods.

   ffeettcchh [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Download  a  bottle  (if available) or source packages for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a. For
       tarballs, also print SHA-256 checksums.

       ----HHEEAADD Fetch HEAD version instead of stable version.

       ----ddeevveell
              Fetch development version instead of stable version.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Remove a previously cached version and re-fetch.

       --vv, ----vveerrbboossee
              Do a verbose VCS checkout, if the URL represents a VCS. This  is
              useful for seeing if an existing VCS cache has been updated.

       ----rreettrryy
              Retry  if  downloading fails or re-download if the checksum of a
              previously cached version no longer matches.

       ----ddeeppss Also download dependencies for any listed _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       --ss, ----bbuuiilldd--ffrroomm--ssoouurrccee
              Download source packages rather than a bottle.

       ----bbuuiilldd--bboottttllee
              Download source packages (for eventual bottling) rather  than  a
              bottle.

       ----ffoorrccee--bboottttllee
              Download a bottle if it exists for the current or newest version
              of macOS, even if it would not be used during installation.

   ggiisstt--llooggss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Upload logs for a failed build of _f_o_r_m_u_l_a to a new  Gist.  Presents  an
       error message if no logs are found.

       ----wwiitthh--hhoossttnnaammee
              Include the hostname in the Gist.

       --nn, ----nneeww--iissssuuee
              Automatically  create  a  new  issue  in  the appropriate GitHub
              repository after creating the Gist.

       --pp, ----pprriivvaattee
              The Gist will be marked private and will not appear in  listings
              but will be accessible with its link.

   hhoommee [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Open  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a's  homepage in a browser, or open Homebrew's own homepage
       if no formula is provided.

   iinnffoo [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Display brief statistics for your Homebrew installation.

       If _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is provided, show summary of information about _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----aannaallyyttiiccss
              List global Homebrew analytics data or, if specified,  installa-
              tion  and  build  error data for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a (provided neither HHOOMMEE--
              BBRREEWW__NNOO__AANNAALLYYTTIICCSS nor HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__NNOO__GGIITTHHUUBB__AAPPII are set).

       ----ddaayyss How many days of analytics data to retrieve. The value for  _d_a_y_s
              must be 3300, 9900 or 336655. The default is 3300.

       ----ccaatteeggoorryy
              Which type of analytics data to retrieve. The value for _c_a_t_e_g_o_r_y
              must be iinnssttaallll, iinnssttaallll--oonn--rreeqquueesstt or bbuuiilldd--eerrrroorr; ccaasskk--iinnssttaallll
              or ooss--vveerrssiioonn may be specified if _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is not. The default is
              iinnssttaallll.

       ----ggiitthhuubb
              Open the GitHub source page for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a in a  browser.  To  view
              formula history locally: bbrreeww lloogg --pp _f_o_r_m_u_l_a

       ----jjssoonn Print  a  JSON  representation of _f_o_r_m_u_l_a. Currently the default
              and only accepted value for _v_e_r_s_i_o_n is  vv11.  See  the  docs  for
              examples  of  using the JSON output: _h_t_t_p_s_:_/_/_d_o_c_s_._b_r_e_w_._s_h_/_Q_u_e_r_y_-
              _i_n_g_-_B_r_e_w

       ----iinnssttaalllleedd
              Print JSON of formulae that are currently installed.

       ----aallll  Print JSON of all available formulae.

       --vv, ----vveerrbboossee
              Show more verbose analytics data for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

   iinnssttaallll [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Install _f_o_r_m_u_l_a. Additional options specific to _f_o_r_m_u_l_a may be appended
       to the command.

       Unless  HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__NNOO__IINNSSTTAALLLL__CCLLEEAANNUUPP  is  set, bbrreeww cclleeaannuupp will then be
       run for the installed formulae or, every 30 days, for all formulae.

       --dd, ----ddeebbuugg
              If brewing fails, open an  interactive  debugging  session  with
              access to IRB or a shell inside the temporary build directory.

       ----eennvv  If  ssttdd is passed, use the standard build environment instead of
              superenv. If ssuuppeerr is passed, use superenv even if  the  formula
              specifies the standard build environment.

       ----iiggnnoorree--ddeeppeennddeenncciieess
              An  unsupported Homebrew development flag to skip installing any
              dependencies of any kind. If the dependencies  are  not  already
              present,  the formula will have issues. If you're not developing
              Homebrew, consider adjusting your PATH rather  than  using  this
              flag.

       ----oonnllyy--ddeeppeennddeenncciieess
              Install  the  dependencies  with  specified  options  but do not
              install the formula itself.

       ----cccc   Attempt to compile using the specified _c_o_m_p_i_l_e_r, which should be
              the  name of the compiler's executable, e.g. ggcccc--77 for GCC 7. In
              order to use  LLVM's  clang,  specify  llllvvmm__ccllaanngg.  To  use  the
              Apple-provided  clang,  specify  ccllaanngg.  This  option  will only
              accept compilers that are provided by Homebrew or  bundled  with
              macOS.  Please  do not file issues if you encounter errors while
              using this option.

       --ss, ----bbuuiilldd--ffrroomm--ssoouurrccee
              Compile _f_o_r_m_u_l_a from source even if a bottle is provided. Depen-
              dencies  will still be installed from bottles if they are avail-
              able.

       ----ffoorrccee--bboottttllee
              Install from a bottle if it exists for  the  current  or  newest
              version  of  macOS,  even  if  it would not normally be used for
              installation.

       ----iinncclluuddee--tteesstt
              Install testing dependencies required to run bbrreeww tteesstt  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----HHEEAADD If  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a  defines  it, install the HEAD version, aka. master,
              trunk, unstable.

       ----ffeettcchh--HHEEAADD
              Fetch the upstream repository to detect if the HEAD installation
              of  the  formula  is  outdated. Otherwise, the repository's HEAD
              will only be checked for updates when a new stable  or  develop-
              ment version has been released.

       ----kkeeeepp--ttmmpp
              Retain the temporary files created during installation.

       ----bbuuiilldd--bboottttllee
              Prepare  the  formula for eventual bottling during installation,
              skipping any post-install steps.

       ----bboottttllee--aarrcchh
              Optimise bottles for the specified architecture rather than  the
              oldest  architecture  supported by the version of macOS the bot-
              tles are built on.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Install without checking for previously  installed  keg-only  or
              non-migrated versions.

       --vv, ----vveerrbboossee
              Print the verification and postinstall steps.

       ----ddiissppllaayy--ttiimmeess
              Print install times for each formula at the end of the run.

       --ii, ----iinntteerraaccttiivvee
              Download  and  patch _f_o_r_m_u_l_a, then open a shell. This allows the
              user to run ..//ccoonnffiigguurree ----hheellpp and otherwise  determine  how  to
              turn the software package into a Homebrew package.

       --gg, ----ggiitt
              Create  a  Git  repository,  useful  for creating patches to the
              software.

   lleeaavveess
       List installed formulae that are not dependencies of another  installed
       formula.

   lliinnkk, llnn [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Symlink  all  of _f_o_r_m_u_l_a's installed files into Homebrew's prefix. This
       is done automatically when you install formulae but can be  useful  for
       DIY installations.

       ----oovveerrwwrriittee
              Delete files that already exist in the prefix while linking.

       --nn, ----ddrryy--rruunn
              List files which would be linked or deleted by bbrreeww lliinnkk ----oovveerr--
              wwrriittee without actually linking or deleting any files.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Allow keg-only formulae to be linked.

   lliisstt, llss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a_|_c_a_s_k]
       List all installed formulae or casks

       If _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is provided, summarise the paths within its current keg.

       ----ffuullll--nnaammee
              Print formulae with fully-qualified names. If ----ffuullll--nnaammee is not
              passed,  other  options  (i.e.  --11, --ll, --rr and --tt) are passed to
              llss(1) which produces the actual output.

       ----uunnbbrreewweedd
              List files in Homebrew's prefix not installed by Homebrew.

       ----vveerrssiioonnss
              Show the version number for  installed  formulae,  or  only  the
              specified formulae if _f_o_r_m_u_l_a are provided.

       ----mmuullttiippllee
              Only show formulae with multiple versions installed.

       ----ppiinnnneedd
              Show  the  versions  of  pinned  formulae, or only the specified
              (pinned) formulae if _f_o_r_m_u_l_a are provided. See also ppiinn,  uunnppiinn.

       ----ffoorrmmuullaa
              List only formulae.

       ----ccaasskk List only casks.

       --11     Force  output to be one entry per line. This is the default when
              output is not to a terminal.

       --ll     List in long format. If the output is to a terminal, a total sum
              for all the file sizes is printed before the long listing.

       --rr     Reverse  the order of the sort to list the oldest entries first.

       --tt     Sort by time modified, listing most recently modified first.

   lloogg [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Show the ggiitt lloogg for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a, or show the log for the Homebrew  reposi-
       tory if no formula is provided.

       --pp, ----ppaattcchh
              Also print patch from commit.

       ----ssttaatt Also print diffstat from commit.

       ----oonneelliinnee
              Print only one line per commit.

       --11     Print only one commit.

       --nn, ----mmaaxx--ccoouunntt
              Print only a specified number of commits.

   mmiiggrraattee [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Migrate  renamed  packages to new names, where _f_o_r_m_u_l_a are old names of
       packages.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Treat installed _f_o_r_m_u_l_a and provided _f_o_r_m_u_l_a as if they are from
              the same taps and migrate them anyway.

   mmiissssiinngg [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Check  the  given  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a kegs for missing dependencies. If no _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       are provided, check all kegs. Will exit with a non-zero status  if  any
       kegs are found to be missing dependencies.

       ----hhiiddee Act  as  if  none  of the specified _h_i_d_d_e_n are installed. _h_i_d_d_e_n
              should be a comma-separated list of formulae.

   ooppttiioonnss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Show install options specific to _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----ccoommppaacctt
              Show all options on a single line separated by spaces.

       ----iinnssttaalllleedd
              Show options for formulae that are currently installed.

       ----aallll  Show options for all available formulae.

       ----ccoommmmaanndd
              Show options for the specified _c_o_m_m_a_n_d.

   oouuttddaatteedd [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a|_c_a_s_k]
       List installed casks and formulae that have an updated  version  avail-
       able.  By  default,  version  information  is  displayed in interactive
       shells, and suppressed otherwise.

              user to run ..//ccoonnffiigguurree ----hheellpp and otherwise  determine  how  to

   ttaapp [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_u_s_e_r//_r_e_p_o] [_U_R_L]
       Tap a formula repository.

       If no arguments are provided, list all installed taps.

       With _U_R_L unspecified, tap a formula repository from GitHub using HTTPS.
       Since so many taps are hosted on GitHub, this command is a shortcut for
       bbrreeww ttaapp _u_s_e_r//_r_e_p_o hhttttppss::////ggiitthhuubb..ccoomm//_u_s_e_r//hhoommeebbrreeww--_r_e_p_o.

       With  _U_R_L  specified, tap a formula repository from anywhere, using any
       transport protocol that ggiitt(1) handles. The one-argument  form  of  ttaapp
       simplifies  but also limits. This two-argument command makes no assump-
       tions, so taps can be cloned from places other than  GitHub  and  using
       protocols other than HTTPS, e.g. SSH, git, HTTP, FTP(S), rsync.

       ----ffuullll Convert  a shallow clone to a full clone without untapping. Taps
              are only cloned as shallow clones on continuous integration,  or
              if ----sshhaallllooww was originally passed.

              only  taps  hosted  on  GitHub are auto-updated (for performance
              reasons).

              structure.

       ----lliisstt--ppiinnnneedd

   aauuddiitt [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Check _f_o_r_m_u_l_a for Homebrew coding style violations. This should be  run
       before  submitting a new formula. If no _f_o_r_m_u_l_a are provided, check all
       locally available formulae and skip style  checks.  Will  exit  with  a
       non-zero status if any errors are found.

       ----ssttrriicctt

       ----ggiitt  Run additional, slower style checks that navigate the Git repos-
              itory.

       ----oonnlliinnee
              Run additional, slower style checks that require a network  con-
              nection.

       ----nneeww--ffoorrmmuullaa
              Run  various  additional style checks to determine if a new for-

              new formula and implies ----ssttrriicctt and ----oonnlliinnee.

              feature.

       ----ddiissppllaayy--ffiilleennaammee

              ified by name

       --DD, ----aauuddiitt--ddeebbuugg

       ----oonnllyy Specify a comma-separated _m_e_t_h_o_d list to only  run  the  methods

   bboottttllee [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Generate a bottle (binary package) from a formula  that  was  installed

       remove it.

       _h_t_t_p_s_:_/_/_r_u_b_y_d_o_c_._b_r_e_w_._s_h_/_F_o_r_m_u_l_a

       ----ffaaiill--iiff--cchhaannggeedd
              Return a failing status code if changes are detected in the man-
              page outputs. This can be used to notify CI  when  the  manpages
              are  out  of  date.  Additionally, the date used in new manpages
              will match those in the existing manpages (to  allow  comparison
              without factoring in the date).

       ----lliinnkk This is now done automatically by bbrreeww uuppddaattee.

   pprr--aauuttoommeerrggee [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Find  pull requests that can be automatically merged using bbrreeww pprr--ppuubb--
       lliisshh.

       ----ttaapp  Target tap repository (default: hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree).

       ----wwiitthh--llaabbeell
              Pull requests must have this label.

       ----wwiitthhoouutt--llaabbeellss
              Pull requests must not have these labels (default: ddoo nnoott mmeerrggee,
              nneeww ffoorrmmuullaa).

       ----wwiitthhoouutt--aapppprroovvaall
              Pull requests do not require approval to be merged.

       ----ppuubblliisshh
              Run bbrreeww pprr--ppuubblliisshh on matching pull requests.

       ----iiggnnoorree--ffaaiilluurreess
              Include pull requests that have failing status checks.

   pprr--ppuubblliisshh [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _p_u_l_l___r_e_q_u_e_s_t [_p_u_l_l___r_e_q_u_e_s_t ...]
       Publish  bottles for a pull request with GitHub Actions. Requires write
       access to the repository.

       ----ttaapp  Target tap repository (default: hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree).

       ----wwoorrkkffllooww
              Target workflow filename (default:  ppuubblliisshh--ccoommmmiitt--bboottttlleess..yymmll).

   pprr--ppuullll [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _p_u_l_l___r_e_q_u_e_s_t [_p_u_l_l___r_e_q_u_e_s_t ...]
       Download  and  publish bottles, and apply the bottle commit from a pull
       request with artifacts generated  by  GitHub  Actions.  Requires  write
       access to the repository.

       ----nnoo--ppuubblliisshh
              Download  the  bottles,  apply  the bottle commit and upload the
              bottles to Bintray, but don't publish them.

       ----nnoo--uuppllooaadd
              Download the bottles and apply  the  bottle  commit,  but  don't
              upload to Bintray.

       --nn, ----ddrryy--rruunn
              Print what would be done rather than doing it.

       ----cclleeaann
              Do not amend the commits from pull requests.

       ----kkeeeepp--oolldd
              If  the formula specifies a rebuild version, attempt to preserve
              its value in the generated DSL.

       ----bbrraanncchh--ookkaayy
              Do not warn if pulling to a branch besides  master  (useful  for
              testing).

       ----rreessoollvvee
              When a patch fails to apply, leave in progress and allow user to
              resolve, instead of aborting.

       ----wwaarrnn--oonn--uuppllooaadd--ffaaiilluurree
              Warn instead of raising an error if  the  bottle  upload  fails.
              Useful for repairing bottle uploads that previously failed.

       ----wwoorrkkffllooww
              Retrieve   artifacts   from  the  specified  workflow  (default:
              tteessttss..yymmll).

       ----aarrttiiffaacctt
              Download artifacts with the specified name (default: bboottttlleess).

       ----bbiinnttrraayy--oorrgg
              Upload to the specified  Bintray  organisation  (default:  hhoommee--
              bbrreeww).

       ----ttaapp  Target tap repository (default: hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree).

       ----rroooott--uurrll
              Use the specified _U_R_L as the root of the bottle's URL instead of
              Homebrew's default.

       ----bbiinnttrraayy--mmiirrrroorr
              Use the specified Bintray  repository  to  automatically  mirror
              stable URLs defined in the formulae (default: mmiirrrroorr).

              Print what would be done rather than doing it.

       ----wwaarrnn--oonn--uuppllooaadd--ffaaiilluurree
              Warn  instead  of  raising  an error if the bottle upload fails.

       ----bbiinnttrraayy--oorrgg

   sshh [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_i_l_e]
       Homebrew  build environment that uses years-battle-hardened build logic
       to help your ..//ccoonnffiigguurree &&&& mmaakkee &&&& mmaakkee  iinnssttaallll  and  even  your  ggeemm
       iinnssttaallll  succeed. Especially handy if you run Homebrew in an Xcode-only
       configuration since it adds tools like mmaakkee to your  PPAATTHH  which  build
       systems would not find otherwise.

       ----eennvv  Use  the standard PPAATTHH instead of superenv's when ssttdd is passed.

       --cc, ----ccmmdd
              Execute commands in a non-interactive shell.

   ssppoonnssoorrss
       Print a Markdown summary of Homebrew's GitHub  Sponsors,  suitable  for
       pasting into a README.

   ssttyyllee [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_i_l_e|_t_a_p|_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Check formulae or files for conformance to Homebrew style guidelines.

       Lists  of  _f_i_l_e,  _t_a_p and _f_o_r_m_u_l_a may not be combined. If none are pro-
       vided, ssttyyllee will run style  checks  on  the  whole  Homebrew  library,
       including core code and all formulae.

       ----ffiixx  Fix  style violations automatically using RuboCop's auto-correct
              feature.

       ----ddiissppllaayy--ccoopp--nnaammeess
              Include the RuboCop cop name for each violation in the output.

       ----oonnllyy--ccooppss
              Specify a comma-separated _c_o_p_s list to check for  violations  of
              only the listed RuboCop cops.

       ----eexxcceepptt--ccooppss
              Specify  a comma-separated _c_o_p_s list to skip checking for viola-
              tions of the listed RuboCop cops.

       ----HHEEAADD Test the head version of a formula.

   tteessttss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]

       ----bbyyeebbuugg

       ----oonnllyy Run  only _t_e_s_t___s_c_r_i_p_t__ssppeecc..rrbb. Appending ::_l_i_n_e___n_u_m_b_e_r will start

   ttyyppeecchheecckk

       ----uuppddaattee--ddeeffiinniittiioonnss

       ----ffaaiill--iiff--nnoott--cchhaannggeedd
              Return  a failing status code if all gems are up to date and gem

       ----ddiirr  Typecheck all files in a specific directory.

       Unpack  the source files for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a into subdirectories of the current

GGLLOOBBAALL OOPPTTIIOONNSS
       These options are applicable across multiple subcommands.

OOFFFFIICCIIAALL EEXXTTEERRNNAALL CCOOMMMMAANNDDSS
   bbuunnddllee [_s_u_b_c_o_m_m_a_n_d]
       Bundler for non-Ruby dependencies from Homebrew, Homebrew Cask, Mac App
       Store and Whalebrew.

       bbrreeww bbuunnddllee [iinnssttaallll]
           Install and upgrade (by default) all dependencies  from  the  BBrreeww--
       ffiillee.

       You can skip the installation of dependencies by adding space-separated
       values to one or more of the  following  environment  variables:  HHOOMMEE--
       BBRREEWW__BBUUNNDDLLEE__BBRREEWW__SSKKIIPP,     HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__BBUUNNDDLLEE__CCAASSKK__SSKKIIPP,     HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__BBUUNN--
       DDLLEE__MMAASS__SSKKIIPP, HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__BBUUNNDDLLEE__WWHHAALLEEBBRREEWW__SSKKIIPP, HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__BBUUNNDDLLEE__TTAAPP__SSKKIIPP

       bbrreeww bbuunnddllee will output a BBrreewwffiillee..lloocckk..jjssoonn in the same  directory  as
       the  BBrreewwffiillee if all dependencies are installed successfully. This con-
       tains dependency and system status information which can be  useful  in
       debugging  bbrreeww  bbuunnddllee  failures  and  replicating  a "last known good
       build" state. You can opt-out of this behaviour by  setting  the  HHOOMMEE--
       BBRREEWW__BBUUNNDDLLEE__NNOO__LLOOCCKK  environment  variable  or  passing  the  ----nnoo--lloocckk
       option. You may wish to check this file into the same  version  control
       system  as your BBrreewwffiillee (or ensure your version control system ignores
       it if you'd prefer to  rely  on  debugging  information  from  a  local
       machine).

       bbrreeww bbuunnddllee dduummpp
           Write all installed casks/formulae/images/taps into a BBrreewwffiillee.

       bbrreeww bbuunnddllee cclleeaannuupp
           Uninstall all dependencies not listed from the BBrreewwffiillee.

       This  workflow  is  useful  for  maintainers  or  testers who regularly
       install lots of formulae.

       bbrreeww bbuunnddllee cchheecckk
           Check if all dependencies are installed from the BBrreewwffiillee .

       This provides a successful exit code if everything is up-to-date,  mak-
       ing it useful for scripting.

       bbrreeww bbuunnddllee lliisstt
           List all dependencies present in a BBrreewwffiillee.

       By default, only Homebrew dependencies are listed.

       bbrreeww bbuunnddllee eexxeecc _c_o_m_m_a_n_d
           Run  an  external command in an isolated build environment based on
       the BBrreewwffiillee dependencies.

       This sanitized  build  environment  ignores  unrequested  dependencies,
       which  makes sure that things you didn't specify in your BBrreewwffiillee won't
       get picked up by commands like bbuunnddllee iinnssttaallll,  nnppmm  iinnssttaallll,  etc.  It
       will also add compiler flags which will help find keg-only dependencies
       like ooppeennssssll, iiccuu44cc, etc.

       ----ffiillee Read the BBrreewwffiillee from this location. Use ----ffiillee==--  to  pipe  to
              stdin/stdout.

       ----gglloobbaall

   sseerrvviicceess [_s_u_b_c_o_m_m_a_n_d]
       Manage background services with macOS' llaauunncchhccttll(1) daemon manager.

       If ssuuddoo is passed, operate on //LLiibbrraarryy//LLaauunncchhDDaaeemmoonnss (started at boot).
       Otherwise, operate on ~~//LLiibbrraarryy//LLaauunncchhAAggeennttss (started at login).

       [ssuuddoo] bbrreeww sseerrvviicceess [lliisstt]
           List all managed services for the current user (or root).

       [ssuuddoo] bbrreeww sseerrvviicceess rruunn (_f_o_r_m_u_l_a|----aallll)
           Run the service _f_o_r_m_u_l_a without registering to launch at login  (or
       boot).

       [ssuuddoo] bbrreeww sseerrvviicceess ssttaarrtt (_f_o_r_m_u_l_a|----aallll)
           Start  the service _f_o_r_m_u_l_a immediately and register it to launch at
       login (or boot).

           Stop the service _f_o_r_m_u_l_a immediately and unregister it from launch-
       ing at login (or boot).

       [ssuuddoo] bbrreeww sseerrvviicceess rreessttaarrtt (_f_o_r_m_u_l_a|----aallll)
           Stop  (if  necessary) and start the service _f_o_r_m_u_l_a immediately and
       register it to launch at login (or boot).

       [ssuuddoo] bbrreeww sseerrvviicceess cclleeaannuupp
           Remove all unused services.

       ----aallll  Run _s_u_b_c_o_m_m_a_n_d on all services.

   tteesstt--bboott [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]:
       Tests the full lifecycle of a Homebrew change to  a  tap  (Git  reposi-
       tory).  For  example,  for a GitHub Actions pull request that changes a
       formula bbrreeww tteesstt--bboott will ensure the system is cleaned  and  setup  to
       test  the formula, install the formula, run various tests and checks on
       it, bottle (package) the binaries and test formulae that depend  on  it
       to ensure they aren't broken by these changes.

       Only supports GitHub Actions as a CI provider. This is because Homebrew
       uses GitHub Actions and it's freely available for  public  and  private
       use with macOS and Linux workers.

       ----ddrryy--rruunn
              print what would be done rather than doing it.

       ----cclleeaannuupp
              clean all state from the Homebrew directory. Use with care!

       ----sskkiipp--sseettuupp
              don't check if the local system is set up correctly.

       ----kkeeeepp--oolldd
              run  bbrreeww  bboottttllee  ----kkeeeepp--oolldd  to build new bottles for a single
              platform.

       ----sskkiipp--rreellooccaattiioonn
              run bbrreeww bboottttllee ----sskkiipp--rreellooccaattiioonn  to  build  new  bottles  that
              don't require relocation.

       ----llooccaall
              ask  Homebrew  to write verbose logs under ..//llooggss// and set $$HHOOMMEE
              to ..//hhoommee//

       ----ttaapp  use the ggiitt repository of the given tap. Defaults  to  the  core
              tap for syntax checking.

       ----ffaaiill--ffaasstt
              immediately exit on a failing step.

       --vv, ----vveerrbboossee
              print  test  step  output  in  real time. Has the side effect of
              passing output as raw bytes instead of re-encoding in UTF-8.

       ----tteesstt--ddeeffaauulltt--ffoorrmmuullaa
              use a default testing formula when not building  a  tap  and  no
              other formulae are specified.

       ----bbiinnttrraayy--oorrgg
              upload to the given Bintray organisation.

       ----rroooott--uurrll
              use the specified _U_R_L as the root of the bottle's URL instead of
              Homebrew's default.

       ----ggiitt--nnaammee
              set the Git author/committer names to the given name.

       ----ggiitt--eemmaaiill
              set the Git author/committer email to the given email.

       ----ccii--uuppllooaadd
              use the Homebrew CI bottle upload options.

       ----ppuubblliisshh
              publish the uploaded bottles.

       ----sskkiipp--rreeccuurrssiivvee--ddeeppeennddeennttss
              only test the direct dependents.

       ----oonnllyy--cclleeaannuupp--bbeeffoorree
              Only run the pre-cleanup step. Needs ----cclleeaannuupp.

       ----oonnllyy--sseettuupp
              Only run the local system setup check step.

       ----oonnllyy--ttaapp--ssyynnttaaxx
              Only run the tap syntax check step.

       ----oonnllyy--ffoorrmmuullaaee
              Only run the formulae steps.

       ----oonnllyy--cclleeaannuupp--aafftteerr
              Only run the post-cleanup step. Needs ----cclleeaannuupp.

CCUUSSTTOOMM EEXXTTEERRNNAALL CCOOMMMMAANNDDSS
       Homebrew, like ggiitt(1), supports external commands. These are executable
       scripts  that  reside  somewhere  in  the  PPAATTHH,  named bbrreeww--_c_m_d_n_a_m_e or
       bbrreeww--_c_m_d_n_a_m_e..rrbb, which can be invoked like bbrreeww  _c_m_d_n_a_m_e.  This  allows
       you to create your own commands without modifying Homebrew's internals.

       Instructions for creating your own commands can be found in  the  docs:
       _h_t_t_p_s_:_/_/_d_o_c_s_._b_r_e_w_._s_h_/_E_x_t_e_r_n_a_l_-_C_o_m_m_a_n_d_s

SSPPEECCIIFFYYIINNGG FFOORRMMUULLAAEE
       Many  Homebrew  commands  accept  one  or more _f_o_r_m_u_l_a arguments. These
       arguments can take several different forms:

       The name of a formula
              e.g. ggiitt, nnooddee, wwggeett.

       The fully-qualified name of a tapped formula
              Sometimes a formula from a tapped repository may  conflict  with
              one  in  hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree.  You  can still access these formulae by
              using a special syntax, e.g. hhoommeebbrreeww//dduuppeess//vviimm or hhoommeebbrreeww//vveerr--
              ssiioonnss//nnooddee44.

       An arbitrary file
              Homebrew can install formulae from a local path. It can point to
              either a formula file or a bottle.

SSPPEECCIIFFYYIINNGG CCAASSKKSS
       Many Homebrew Cask commands accept one or more  _c_a_s_k  arguments.  These
       can  be  specified  the  same way as the _f_o_r_m_u_l_a arguments described in
       SSPPEECCIIFFYYIINNGG FFOORRMMUULLAAEE above.

EENNVVIIRROONNMMEENNTT
       Note that environment variables must have a value set to  be  detected.
       For  example,  run  eexxppoorrtt  HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__NNOO__IINNSSEECCUURREE__RREEDDIIRREECCTT==11 rather than
       just eexxppoorrtt HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__NNOO__IINNSSEECCUURREE__RREEDDIIRREECCTT.

       HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__AARRCCHH
              Linux only: Pass the set value to a type name  representing  the
              compiler's --mmaarrcchh option.

              _D_e_f_a_u_l_t_: nnaattiivvee.

       HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__AARRTTIIFFAACCTT__DDOOMMAAIINN
              Prefix all download URLs, including those for bottles, with this
              variable.  For  example,  HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__AARRTTIIFFAACCTT__DDOOMMAAIINN==hhttttpp::////llooccaall--
              hhoosstt::88008800  will  cause  a  formula  with  the  URL hhttttppss::////eexxaamm--
              ppllee..ccoomm//ffoooo..ttaarr..ggzz  to  instead  download   from   hhttttpp::////llooccaall--
              hhoosstt::88008800//eexxaammppllee..ccoomm//ffoooo..ttaarr..ggzz.

       HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__AAUUTTOO__UUPPDDAATTEE__SSEECCSS
              Automatically  check for updates once per this seconds interval.

              If set, use bbaatt for the bbrreeww ccaatt command.

              Use   the   bbaatt   configuration   file.   For   example,   HHOOMMEE--

       HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__CCAASSKK__OOPPTTSS

              Use this editor when editing a single formula, or several formu-
              lae in the same directory.

              _N_o_t_e_: bbrreeww eeddiitt will open all of Homebrew as discontinuous files
              and directories. Visual Studio Code can handle this correctly in
              project mode, but many editors will do strange  things  in  this
              case.

              _D_e_f_a_u_l_t_: $$EEDDIITTOORR or $$VVIISSUUAALL.

       HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__FFAAIILL__LLOOGG__LLIINNEESS
              Output this many lines of output on formula ssyysstteemm failures.

              _D_e_f_a_u_l_t_: 1155.

              a license on this list.

              If  set,  verbose  output  will  print  a  .. no more than once a

       aallll__pprrooxxyy
              Use  this SOCKS5 proxy for ccuurrll(1), ggiitt(1) and ssvvnn(1) when down-

       ffttpp__pprrooxxyy
              Use this FTP proxy for ccuurrll(1), ggiitt(1) and ssvvnn(1) when download-

       hhttttpp__pprrooxxyy
              Use  this  HTTP  proxy for ccuurrll(1), ggiitt(1) and ssvvnn(1) when down-
              loading through Homebrew.

       hhttttppss__pprrooxxyy
              Use this HTTPS proxy for ccuurrll(1), ggiitt(1) and ssvvnn(1)  when  down-
              loading through Homebrew.

       nnoo__pprrooxxyy
              A  comma-separated  list  of hostnames and domain names excluded
              from proxying by ccuurrll(1), ggiitt(1)  and  ssvvnn(1)  when  downloading
              through Homebrew.

       SSUUDDOO__AASSKKPPAASSSS
              When  this variable is set, the --AA option is passed when calling
              ssuuddoo(8)

UUSSIINNGG HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW BBEEHHIINNDD AA PPRROOXXYY
       Set the hhttttpp__pprrooxxyy, hhttttppss__pprrooxxyy, aallll__pprrooxxyy, ffttpp__pprrooxxyy  and/or  nnoo__pprrooxxyy
       environment variables documented above.

       For example, to use an unauthenticated HTTP or SOCKS5 proxy:



           export http_proxy=http://$HOST:$PORT

           export all_proxy=socks5://$HOST:$PORT



       And for an authenticated HTTP proxy:

summary:
# lvcreate

> Creates a logical volume in an existing volume group.
> A volume group is a collection of logical and physical volumes.

- Create a logical volume of 10 gigabytes in the volume group vg1:

`lvcreate -L {{10G}} {{vg1}}`

- Create a 1500 megabyte linear logical volume named mylv in the volume group vg1:

`lvcreate -L {{1500}} -n {{mylv}} {{vg1}}`

- Create a logical volume called mylv that uses 60% of the total space in volume group vg1:

`lvcreate -l {{60%VG}} -n {{mylv}} {{vg1}}`

- Create a logical volume called mylv that uses all of the unallocated space in the volume group vg1:

`lvcreate -l {{100%FREE}} -n {{mylv}} {{vg1}}`

# mac2unix

> Change macOS-style line endings to Unix-style.
> Replaces LF with CR.

- Change the line endings of a file:

`mac2unix {{filename}}`

- Create a copy with Unix-style line endings:

`mac2unix -n {{filename}} {{new_filename}}`

# hwclock

> Used for reading or changing the hardware clock. Usually requires root.

- Display the current time as reported by the hardware clock:

`hwclock`

- Write the current software clock time to the hardware clock (sometimes used during system setup):

`hwclock --systohc`

- Write the current hardware clock time to the software clock:

`hwclock --hctosys`

# pacman4console

> A text-based console game inspired by the original Pacman.
> More information: <https://github.com/YoctoForBeaglebone/pacman4console>.

- Start a game at Level 1:

`pacman4console`

- Start a game on a certain level (there are nine official levels):

`pacman4console --level={{level_number}}`

- Start the pacman4console level editor, saving to a specified text file:

`pacman4consoleedit {{path/to/level_file}}`

- Play a custom level:

`pacman4console --level={{path/to/level_file}}`

# compgen

> A built-in command for auto-completion in bash, which is called on pressing TAB key twice.

- List all commands that you could run:

`compgen -c`

- List all aliases:

`compgen -a`

- List all functions that you could run:

`compgen -A function`

- Show shell reserved key words:

`compgen -k`

- See all available commands/aliases starting with 'ls':

`compgen -ac {{ls}}`

# eval

> Execute arguments as a single command in the current shell and return its result.

- Call `echo` with the "foo" argument:

`eval "{{echo foo}}"`

- Set a variable in the current shell:

`eval "{{foo=bar}}"`

     pprriinntteennvv, ppuusshhdd, ppwwdd, rreeaadd, rreeaaddoonnllyy, rreehhaasshh, rreeppeeaatt, rreettuurrnn, sscchheedd, sseett,

     wwhheerree, wwhhiicchh, wwhhiillee -- shell built-in commands

SSYYNNOOPPSSIISS
     bbuuiillttiinn [--ooppttiioonnss] [_a_r_g_s _._._.]

DDEESSCCRRIIPPTTIIOONN
     Shell builtin commands are commands that can be executed within the run-
     ning shell's process.  Note that, in the case of csh(1) builtin commands,
     the command is executed in a subshell if it occurs as any component of a
     pipeline except the last.

     If a command specified to the shell contains a slash ``/'', the shell
     will not execute a builtin command, even if the last component of the
     specified command matches the name of a builtin command.  Thus, while
     specifying ``eecchhoo'' causes a builtin command to be executed under shells
     that support the eecchhoo builtin command, specifying ``//bbiinn//eecchhoo'' or
     ``..//eecchhoo'' does not.

     While some builtin commands may exist in more than one shell, their oper-
     ation may be different under each shell which supports them.  Below is a
     table which lists shell builtin commands, the standard shells that sup-
     port them and whether they exist as standalone utilities.

     Only builtin commands for the csh(1) and sh(1) shells are listed here.
     Consult a shell's manual page for details on the operation of its builtin
     commands.  Beware that the sh(1) manual page, at least, calls some of
     these commands ``built-in commands'' and some of them ``reserved words''.
     Users of other shells may need to consult an info(1) page or other
     sources of documentation.

     Commands marked ``No**'' under _E_x_t_e_r_n_a_l do exist externally, but are
     implemented as scripts using a builtin command of the same name.

summary:
# apt-key

> Key management utility for the APT Package Manager on Debian and Ubuntu.

- List trusted keys:

`apt-key list`

- Add a key to the trusted keystore:

`apt-key add {{public_key_file.asc}}`

- Delete a key from the trusted keystore:

`apt-key del {{key_id}}`

- Add a remote key to the trusted keystore:

`wget -qO - {{https://host.tld/filename.key}} | apt-key add -`

- Add a key from keyserver with only key id:

`apt-key adv --keyserver {{pgp.mit.edu}} --recv {{KEYID}}`

# progress

> Display/Monitor the progress of running coreutils.
> More information: <https://github.com/Xfennec/progress>.

- Show the progress of running coreutils:

`progress`

- Show the progress of running coreutils in quiet mode:

`progress -q`

- Launch and monitor a single long-running command:

`{{command}} & progress -mp $!`

# groupdel

> Delete existing user groups from the system.

- Delete an existing group:

`groupdel {{group_name}}`

# pidof

> Gets the ID of a process using its name.

- List all process IDs with given name:

`pidof {{bash}}`

- List a single process ID with given name:

`pidof -s {{bash}}`

- List process IDs including scripts with given name:

`pidof -x {{script.py}}`

- Kill all processes with given name:

`kill "$(pidof {{name}})" `

# mke2fs

> Creates a Linux filesystem inside a partition.

- Create an ext2 filesystem in partition 1 of device b (`sdb1`):

`mkfs.ext2 {{/dev/sdb1}}`

- Create an ext3 filesystem in partition 1 of device b (`sdb1`):

`mkfs.ext3 {{/dev/sdb1}}`

- Create an ext3 filesystem in partition 1 of device b (`sdb1`):

`mkfs.ext3 {{/dev/sdb1}}`

# lrztar

> A wrapper for `lrzip` to simplify compression of directories.
> See also: `tar`, `lrzuntar`, `lrunzip`.

- Archive a directory with `tar`, then compress:

`lrztar {{path/to/directory}}`

- Same as above, with ZPAQ - extreme compression, but very slow:

`lrztar -z {{path/to/directory}}`

- Specify the output file:

`lrztar -o {{path/to/file}} {{path/to/directory}}`

- Override the number of processor threads to use:

`lrztar -p {{8}} {{path/to/directory}}`

- Force overwriting of existing files:

`lrztar -f {{path/to/directory}}`

# fsck

> Check the integrity of a filesystem or repair it. The filesystem should be unmounted at the time the command is run.

- Check filesystem /dev/sda, reporting any damaged blocks:

`fsck {{/dev/sda}}`

- Check filesystem /dev/sda, reporting any damaged blocks and interactively letting the user choose to repair each one:

`fsck -r {{/dev/sda}}`

- Check filesystem /dev/sda, reporting any damaged blocks and automatically repairing them:

`fsck -a {{/dev/sda}}`
man_entry:
FSCK(8)                   BSD System Manager's Manual                  FSCK(8)

NNAAMMEE
     ffsscckk -- filesystem consistency check and interactive repair

SSYYNNOOPPSSIISS
     ffsscckk --pp [--ff]
     ffsscckk [--ll _m_a_x_p_a_r_a_l_l_e_l] [--qq] [--yy] [--nn] [--dd]

DDEESSCCRRIIPPTTIIOONN
     The first form of ffsscckk preens a standard set of filesystems or the speci-
     fied filesystems.  It is normally used in the script _/_e_t_c_/_r_c during auto-
     matic reboot.  Here ffsscckk reads the filesystem descriptor table (using
     getfsent(3)) to determine which filesystems to check.  Only partitions
     that have ``rw,'' ``rq'' or ``ro'' as options, and that have non-zero
     pass number are checked.  Filesystems with pass number 1 (normally just
     the root filesystem) are checked one at a time.  When pass 1 completes,
     all remaining filesystems are checked, running one process per disk
     drive.  The disk drive containing each filesystem is inferred from the
     shortest prefix of the device name that ends in one or more digits; the
     remaining characters are assumed to be the partition designator.  In
     preening mode, filesystems that are marked clean are skipped.  Filesys-
     tems are marked clean when they are unmounted, when they have been
     mounted read-only, or when ffsscckk runs on them successfully.

     It should be noted that ffsscckk is now essentially a wrapper that invokes
     other _f_s_c_k___X_X_X utilities as needed.  Currently, ffsscckk can invoke _f_s_c_k___h_f_s,
     _f_s_c_k___a_p_f_s, _f_s_c_k___m_s_d_o_s, _f_s_c_k___e_x_f_a_t, and _f_s_c_k___u_d_f.  If this underlying
     process that ffsscckk invokes encounters serious inconsistencies or the
     filesystem type is not one of the above, it exits with an abnormal return
     status and an automatic reboot will then fail.  For each corrected incon-
     sistency one or more lines will be printed identifying the filesystem on
     which the correction will take place, and the nature of the correction.

     If sent a QUIT signal, ffsscckk will finish the filesystem checks, then exit
     with an abnormal return status that causes an automatic reboot to fail.
     This is useful when you want to finish the filesystem checks during an
     automatic reboot, but do not want the machine to come up multiuser after
     the checks complete.

     Without the --pp option, ffsscckk audits and interactively repairs inconsistent
     conditions for filesystems.  It should be noted that some of the correc-
     tive actions which are not correctable under the --pp option will result in
     some loss of data.  The amount and severity of data lost may be deter-
     mined from the diagnostic output.  If the operator does not have write
     permission on the filesystem ffsscckk will default to a --nn action.

     The following flags are interpreted by ffsscckk and passed along to the
     underlying tool that it spawns.

     --ff          Force fsck to check `clean' filesystems when preening.

     --ll          Limit the number of parallel checks to the number specified
                 in the following argument.  By default, the limit is the num-
                 ber of disks, running one process per disk.  If a smaller
                 limit is given, the disks are checked round-robin, one
                 filesystem at a time.

     --RR          Specify a particular passno number for which fsck is to
                 check.  You may only specify 1 or 2.  Only those filesystems
                 matching that particular passno entry (if using fstab) will
                 be checked.  For more information on the passno field, see
                 fstab(5).

     --pp          "Preen" mode, described above.

     --qq          Do a quick check to determine if the filesystem was unmounted
                 cleanly.

     --yy          Assume a yes response to all questions asked by ffsscckk; this
                 should be used with great caution as this is a free license
                 to continue after essentially unlimited trouble has been
                 encountered.

     --nn          Assume a no response to all questions asked by ffsscckk except
                 for `CONTINUE?', which is assumed to be affirmative; do not
                 open the filesystem for writing.

     If no filesystems are given to ffsscckk then a default list of filesystems is
     read using getfsent(3).

     Because of inconsistencies between the block device and the buffer cache,
     the raw device should always be used.

SSEEEE AALLSSOO
     fs(5), fsck_hfs(8), fsck_apfs(8), fsck_msdos(8), getfsent(3), fstab(5,)
     reboot(8)

4th Berkeley Distribution        May 18, 2010        4th Berkeley Distribution

summary:
# rpcinfo

> Makes an RPC call to an RPC server and reports what it finds.

- Show full table of all RPC services registered on localhost:

`rpcinfo`

- Show concise table of all RPC services registered on localhost:

`rpcinfo -s {{localhost}}`

- Display table of statistics of rpcbind operations on localhost:

`rpcinfo -m`

- Display list of entries of given service name (mountd) and version number (2) on a remote nfs share:

`rpcinfo -l {{remote_nfs_server_ip}} {{mountd}} {{2}}`

- Delete the registration for version 1 of the mountd service for all transports:

`rpcinfo -d {{mountd}} {{1}}`

NNAAMMEE

SSYYNNOOPPSSIISS

     rrppcciinnffoo [----rrppccbbvveerrss _v_e_r_s_i_o_n] --bb [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
     rrppcciinnffoo [----rrppccbbvveerrss _v_e_r_s_i_o_n] --dd [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
     rrppcciinnffoo --ll [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [_h_o_s_t] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
     rrppcciinnffoo [----rrppccbbvveerrss _v_e_r_s_i_o_n] ----ggeettaaddddrr [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [_h_o_s_t] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
     rrppcciinnffoo ----ggeettvveerrssaaddddrr [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [_h_o_s_t] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
     rrppcciinnffoo ----iinnddiirreecctt [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [host] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
     rrppcciinnffoo [----rrppccbbvveerrss _v_e_r_s_i_o_n] ----ttiimmee [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [_h_o_s_t]
     rrppcciinnffoo {----hheellpp | --hh}
     rrppcciinnffoo --pp [_h_o_s_t]
     rrppcciinnffoo [--nn _p_o_r_t_n_u_m] --uu _h_o_s_t _p_r_o_g_r_a_m [_v_e_r_s_i_o_n]
     rrppcciinnffoo [--nn _p_o_r_t_n_u_m] --tt _h_o_s_t _p_r_o_g_r_a_m [_v_e_r_s_i_o_n]

DDEESSCCRRIIPPTTIIOONN
     rrppcciinnffoo makes an RPC call to an RPC server and reports what it finds.
     Unless otherwise specified or noted below the default rrppccbbiinndd protocol
     version is 3.  With no or only generic options, call the rrppccbbiinndd dump
     procedure on the specified _h_o_s_t or ``localhost'' if _h_o_s_t is not specified
     and display the results.  For versions 3 and 4 display the program num-
     ber, the version, the ``netid'', the universal address that the services
     is listening on, symbolic name of the program if known, and then the
     owner that registered the <program, version, netid, address> tuple.  For
     version 2 of the protocol list the program, version, protocol, port, and
     symbolic program name.  _S_e_e _t_h_e ----ssuummmmaarryy _o_p_t_i_o_n _b_e_l_o_w _f_o_r _a _t_y_p_i_c_a_l_l_y
     _m_o_r_e _u_s_e_f_u_l _o_u_t_p_u_t_. rrppccbbiinndd defaults the _n_e_t_i_d to ``tcp'' for the dump
     procedure.

     The _p_r_o_g_r_a_m argument can be either a name or a number.

     If a version is specified, rpcinfo attempts to call that version of the
     specified program.  Otherwise, if the version is optional rrppcciinnffoo
     attempts to find all the registered version numbers for the specified
     program by calling version 0 (which is presumed not to exist; if it does
     exist, rpcinfo attempts to obtain this information by calling an
     extremely high version number instead) and attempts to call each regis-
     tered version.

     A required transport option is needed for the second and third lines of
     the synopsis which is used to ping, i.e., call the null procedure of the
     specified program and version. The results will be displayed on stdout.
     If version is not specified each valid version found as described above
     will be called.  The third synopsis will use the supplied universal
     address over the transport specified by _n_e_t_i_d to call the null procedure
     of the specified _p_r_o_g_r_a_m in the same manner as above. In addition the
     last two lines of the synopsis can ``ping'' the server as described in
     the LLeeggaaccyy OOppttiioonnss section below.

GGEENNEERRIICC OOPPTTIIOONNSS
     ----rrppccbbvveerrss _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
             Attempt to use the supplied rrppccbbiinndd _v_e_r_s_i_o_n_. Note some options
             below are version specific and this option may be ignored. If
             specifying version 2 (ppoorrttmmaappppeerr), _n_e_t_i_d below must be one of
             ``udp'' or ``tcp''.

     --TT _n_e_t_i_d
             Specify the netid to use. Supported netids are ``udp'', ``tcp'',
             ``udp6'', and ``tcp6''.

     ----ttiimmeeoouutt _s_e_c_o_n_d_s
             Timeout used in creating client handles and the client calls to
             rrppccbbiinndd.. Current default is 12 seconds.

     Generic options may be supplied with any of the rrppcciinnffoo options below,
     though some options will override their values.

LLEEGGAACCYY OOPPTTIIOONNSS
     The options below imply version 2 (ppoorrttmmaappppeerr) rrppccbbiinndd calls. They are
     compatible with older versions of rrppcciinnffoo.

     {--pp | ----ppoorrttmmaapp} [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [_h_o_s_t]
             Probe the portmapper on _h_o_s_t, and print a list of all registered
             RPC programs.  If _h_o_s_t is not specified, it defaults to the value
             ``localhost''.

     {--uu | ----uuddppppiinngg} _h_o_s_t _p_r_o_g_r_a_m [_v_e_r_s_i_o_n]
             Make an RPC call to the NULL procedure of _p_r_o_g_r_a_m on the speci-
             fied _h_o_s_t using UDP, and report whether a response was received.

     {--tt | ----ttccppppiinngg} _h_o_s_t _p_r_o_g_r_a_m [_v_e_r_s_i_o_n]
             Make an RPC call to the NULL procedure of _p_r_o_g_r_a_m on the speci-
             fied _h_o_s_t using TCP, and report whether a response was received.

     {--nn | ----ppoorrttnnuumm} _p_o_r_t_n_u_m
             Use _p_o_r_t_n_u_m as the port number for the --tt and --uu options instead
             of the port number given by the portmapper.

OOPPTTIIOONNSS
     {--bb | ----bbrrooaaddccaasstt} _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
             Make an RPC multicast over INET6 to the RPCB_MULTICAST_ADDR,
             ``FF02::202'', and broadcast over INET using UDP to procedure 0
             of the specified _p_r_o_g_r_a_m and _v_e_r_s_i_o_n and report all hosts that
             respond.  rrppcciiffnnoo will first use RPCBIND version 3 and then call
             the broadcast procedure of the ppoorrttmmaappppeerr protocol to collect
             older hosts. There is a reply cache kept so duplicates will not
             be returned unless the cache fills.

             Note that the --bb option by its self is compatible with the older
             ppoorrttmmaappppeerr.  However, specifying ----rrppccbbvveerrss 2 will short circuit
             the rrppccbbiinndd version 3 calls and only call the ppoorrttmmaappppeerr.

     {--dd | ----ddeelleettee} [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
             Delete registration for the RPC service of the specified _p_r_o_g_r_a_m
             and _v_e_r_s_i_o_n.  If the _n_e_t_i_d is specified, only unregister the
             _p_r_o_g_r_a_m and _v_e_r_s_i_o_n over that transport.  This option can be
             exercised only by the super-user or the user who registered the
             the RPC service.

     ----ggeettaaddddrr [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [_h_o_s_t] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
             Get the universal address that the client can use to contact the
             _p_r_o_g_r_a_m and _v_e_r_s_i_o_n from _h_o_s_t over _n_e_t_i_d.  If host is not speci-
             fied _l_o_c_a_l_h_o_s_t is assumed. If _n_e_t_i_d is not specified ``udp'' is
             assumed. If the specified _v_e_r_s_i_o_n is not available but some other
             version is, return the universal address for one of those ver-
             sions of the program.

     ----ggeettvveerrssaaddddrr [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [_h_o_s_t] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
             Get the universal address that the client can use to contact the
             _p_r_o_g_r_a_m and _v_e_r_s_i_o_n from _h_o_s_t over _n_e_t_i_d.  If host is not speci-
             fied _l_o_c_a_l_h_o_s_t is assumed. If _n_e_t_i_d is not specified ``udp'' is
             assumed. If the version is not available then that will be indi-
             cated. This requires the remote rrppccbbiinndd support version 4.

     --hh      Print out the synopsis of this program.

     ----hheellpp  Print out the synopsis and an explanation of the options.

     ----iinnddiirreecctt [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [_h_o_s_t] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
             Send a indirect call to the null procedure of _p_r_o_g_r_a_m and _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
             on the specified _h_o_s_t or localhost.  This requires the remote
             rrppccbbiinndd to support version 4.

     {--ll | ----lliisstt} [--TT _n_e_t_i_d] [_h_o_s_t] _p_r_o_g_r_a_m _v_e_r_s_i_o_n
             List the transports available over the transport family specified
             by the _n_e_t_i_d for the given _p_r_o_g_r_a_m and _v_e_r_s_i_o_n on the optional
             _h_o_s_t or localhost if not specified.  Requires the remote rrppccbbiinndd
             to support version 4.  The default transport family is INET.

     {--mm | ----mmeettrriiccss}
             Print the metrics of rrppccbbiinndd daemon for the specified _h_o_s_t or
             _l_o_c_a_l_h_o_s_t if not specified.  Requires support for rrppccbbiinndd ver-
             sion 4 on the remote.

     {--ss | ----ssuummmmaarryy}
             Print a summary of programs registered on _h_o_s_t or ``localhost''
             if host is not specified.  For each program registered list any
             versions followed by any transports supported by that program.
             Try to list the symbolic name of the transport and the owner that
             registered the program.

     ----ttiimmee [host]
             Return rrppccbbiinndd''ss version of time on the specified _h_o_s_t_.

EEXXAAMMPPLLEESS
     To show all of the RPC services registered on the local machine use:

           example% rpcinfo

     To show all of the RPC services registered on the machine named _k_l_a_x_o_n
     use:

           example% rpcinfo klaxon

     More usefully to show the services registered on _k_l_a_x_o_n use:

           example% rpcinfo -s klaxon

     To show all of the RPC services from an older host only running version 2
     of rrppccbbiinndd on a host named _h_o_r_n use:

           example% rpcinfo -p horn

     To show all machines on the local net that are running the NFS File ser-
     vice use:

           example% rpcinfo -b nfs 'version'

     where 'version' is one of the current nfs versions of interest.

     To delete the registration for version 1 of the rrqquuoottaadd service use:

           example% rpcinfo -d rquotad 1

SSEEEE AALLSSOO
     rpc(5), rpcbind(8)

     _R_P_C _P_r_o_g_r_a_m_m_i_n_g _G_u_i_d_e.

     _R_F_C _1_8_3_3 _B_i_n_d_i_n_g _P_r_o_t_o_c_o_l_s _f_o_r _O_N_C _R_P_C _V_e_r_s_i_o_n _2.

     _R_F_C _5_6_6_5 _I_A_N_A _C_o_n_s_i_d_e_r_a_t_i_o_n_s _f_o_r _R_e_m_o_t_e _P_r_o_c_e_d_u_r_e _C_a_l_l _(_R_P_C_) _N_e_t_w_o_r_k
     _I_d_e_n_t_i_f_i_e_r_s _a_n_d _U_n_i_v_e_r_s_a_l _A_d_d_r_e_s_s _F_o_r_m_a_t_s.

BBUUGGSS
     In summary mode the maximum number of versions and transports is 16. The
     first 16 versions and the first 16 transports received from the server
     are displayed and the rest is silently ignored.

     In the second synopsis line, for a host that is specified as a link-local
     INET6 address will always return ``no route to host''.

     In releases prior to SunOS 3.0, the Network File System (NFS) did not
     register itself with the portmapper; rrppcciinnffoo cannot be used to make RPC
     calls to the NFS server on hosts running such releases.

summary:
# sysctl

> List and change kernel runtime variables.

- Show all available variables and their values:

`sysctl -a`

- Set a changeable kernel state variable:

`sysctl -w {{section.tunable}}={{value}}`

- Get currently open file handlers:

`sysctl fs.file-nr`

- Get limit for simultaneous open files:

`sysctl fs.file-max`

- Apply changes from /etc/sysctl.conf:

`sysctl -p`
man_entry:
SYSCTL(8)                 BSD System Manager's Manual                SYSCTL(8)

NNAAMMEE
     ssyyssccttll -- get or set kernel state

SSYYNNOOPPSSIISS
     ssyyssccttll [--bbddeehhiiNNnnooqqxx] _n_a_m_e[=_v_a_l_u_e] _._._.
     ssyyssccttll [--bbddeehhNNnnooqqxx] --aa

DDEESSCCRRIIPPTTIIOONN
     The ssyyssccttll utility retrieves kernel state and allows processes with
     appropriate privilege to set kernel state.  The state to be retrieved or
     set is described using a ``Management Information Base'' (``MIB'') style
     name, described as a dotted set of components.

     The following options are available:

     --AA      Equivalent to --oo --aa (for compatibility).

     --aa      List all the currently available non-opaque values.  This option
             is ignored if one or more variable names are specified on the
             command line.

     --bb      Force the value of the variable(s) to be output in raw, binary
             format.  No names are printed and no terminating newlines are
             output.  This is mostly useful with a single variable.

     --dd      Print the description of the variable instead of its value.

     --ee      Separate the name and the value of the variable(s) with `='.
             This is useful for producing output which can be fed back to the
             ssyyssccttll utility.  This option is ignored if either --NN or --nn is
             specified, or a variable is being set.

     --hh      Format output for human, rather than machine, readability.

     --ii      Ignore unknown OIDs.  The purpose is to make use of ssyyssccttll for
             collecting data from a variety of machines (not all of which are
             necessarily running exactly the same software) easier.

     --NN      Show only variable names, not their values.  This is particularly
             useful with shells that offer programmable completion.  To enable
             completion of variable names in zsh(1) (_p_o_r_t_s_/_s_h_e_l_l_s_/_z_s_h), use
             the following code:

                   listsysctls () { set -A reply $(sysctl -AN ${1%.*}) }
                   compctl -K listsysctls sysctl

             To enable completion of variable names in tcsh(1), use:

                   complete sysctl 'n/*/`sysctl -Na`/'

     --nn      Show only variable values, not their names.  This option is use-
             ful for setting shell variables.  For instance, to save the page-
             size in variable _p_s_i_z_e, use:

                   set psize=`sysctl -n hw.pagesize`

     --oo      Show opaque variables (which are normally suppressed).  The for-
             mat and length are printed, as well as a hex dump of the first
             sixteen bytes of the value.

     --qq      Suppress some warnings generated by ssyyssccttll to standard error.

     --XX      Equivalent to --xx --aa (for compatibility).

     --xx      As --oo, but prints a hex dump of the entire value instead of just
             the first few bytes.

     The information available from ssyyssccttll consists of integers, strings, and
     opaque types.  The ssyyssccttll utility only knows about a couple of opaque
     types, and will resort to hexdumps for the rest.  The opaque information
     is much more useful if retrieved by special purpose programs such as
     ps(1), systat(1), and netstat(1).

     The string and integer information is summarized below.  For a detailed
     description of these variable see sysctl(3).

     The changeable column indicates whether a process with appropriate privi-
     lege can change the value.  String and integer values can be set using
     ssyyssccttll.
